pullRequest.body:
Co-PR :  #9087 (maximal ideals of Artinian ring are finite)

Co-authored-by: Andrew Yang <the.erd.one@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Junyan Xu <junyanxumath@gmail.com>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
I agree with Junyan that we should use #9190 to show these.
Something like 
```lean
lemma minimalPrimes_eq_minimals {R} [CommRing R] :
    minimalPrimes R = minimals (· ≤ ·) (setOf Ideal.IsPrime) :=
  congr_arg (minimals (· ≤ ·)) (by simp)

lemma PrimeSpectrum.vanishingIdeal_isclosed_isIrreducible {R} [CommRing R] :
    vanishingIdeal (R := R) '' {s | IsClosed s ∧ IsIrreducible s} = setOf Ideal.IsPrime :=
  Set.ext fun I ↦ ⟨fun ⟨s, ⟨hs, hs'⟩, e⟩ ↦
    e ▸ (isIrreducible_zeroLocus_iff_of_radical _ (isRadical_vanishingIdeal s)).mp
      (by rwa [zeroLocus_vanishingIdeal_eq_closure, hs.closure_eq]),
    fun h ↦ ⟨zeroLocus I, ⟨isClosed_zeroLocus I,
      (isIrreducible_zeroLocus_iff_of_radical _ h.isRadical).mpr h⟩,
        (vanishingIdeal_zeroLocus_eq_radical I).trans h.radical⟩⟩

open PrimeSpectrum in
lemma minimalPrimes.eq_irreducibleComponents :
    minimalPrimes R =
    PrimeSpectrum.vanishingIdeal '' (irreducibleComponents <| PrimeSpectrum R) := by
  rw [irreducibleComponents_eq_maximals_closed, minimalPrimes_eq_minimals, ← minimals_swap,
    ← PrimeSpectrum.vanishingIdeal_isclosed_isIrreducible, image_minimals_of_rel_iff_rel]
  intro s t hs _
  exact vanishingIdeal_anti_mono_iff hs.1

lemma PrimeSpectrum.zeroLocus_minimalPrimes :
  zeroLocus ∘ (↑) '' minimalPrimes R =
    irreducibleComponents (PrimeSpectrum R) := by
  rw [minimalPrimes.eq_irreducibleComponents, ← Set.image_comp, Set.EqOn.image_eq_self]
  intros s hs
  simpa [zeroLocus_vanishingIdeal_eq_closure, closure_eq_iff_isClosed]
    using isClosed_of_mem_irreducibleComponents s hs

lemma PrimeSpectrum.mem_irreducibleComponents_iff_vanishingIdeal_mem_minimalPrimes'
    {s : Set (PrimeSpectrum R)} (hs : IsClosed s) :
    s ∈ irreducibleComponents (PrimeSpectrum R) ↔ (vanishingIdeal s) ∈ minimalPrimes R := by
  constructor
  · rw [minimalPrimes.eq_irreducibleComponents]; exact Set.mem_image_of_mem _
  · conv_rhs => rw [← zeroLocus_minimalPrimes, ← hs.closure_eq,
      ← zeroLocus_vanishingIdeal_eq_closure]
    exact Set.mem_image_of_mem _

lemma PrimeSpectrum.zeroLocus_ideal_mem_irreducibleComponents_iff_mem_minimalPrime' (I : Ideal R) :
    zeroLocus I ∈ irreducibleComponents (PrimeSpectrum R) ↔
    ∃ (J : Ideal R), J ∈ minimalPrimes R ∧ zeroLocus I = zeroLocus (J : Set R) := by
  rw [← PrimeSpectrum.zeroLocus_minimalPrimes]
  simp_rw [eq_comm (a := zeroLocus (I : Set R))]
  rfl

lemma PrimeSpectrum.zeroLocus_ideal_mem_irreducibleComponents_iff_mem_minimalPrime_of_radical'
    {I : Ideal R} (hI : I.IsRadical) :
    zeroLocus I ∈ irreducibleComponents (PrimeSpectrum R) ↔ I ∈ minimalPrimes R := by
  constructor
  · conv_rhs => rw [minimalPrimes.eq_irreducibleComponents, ← hI.radical,
      ← vanishingIdeal_zeroLocus_eq_radical]
    exact Set.mem_image_of_mem _
  · rw [← PrimeSpectrum.zeroLocus_minimalPrimes]
    exact Set.mem_image_of_mem _
```

> I agree with Junyan that we should use #9190 to show these. Something like
> 
> ```lean
> lemma minimalPrimes_eq_minimals {R} [CommRing R] :
>     minimalPrimes R = minimals (· ≤ ·) (setOf Ideal.IsPrime) :=
>   congr_arg (minimals (· ≤ ·)) (by simp)
> 
> lemma PrimeSpectrum.vanishingIdeal_isclosed_isIrreducible {R} [CommRing R] :
>     vanishingIdeal (R := R) '' {s | IsClosed s ∧ IsIrreducible s} = setOf Ideal.IsPrime :=
>   Set.ext fun I ↦ ⟨fun ⟨s, ⟨hs, hs'⟩, e⟩ ↦
>     e ▸ (isIrreducible_zeroLocus_iff_of_radical _ (isRadical_vanishingIdeal s)).mp
>       (by rwa [zeroLocus_vanishingIdeal_eq_closure, hs.closure_eq]),
>     fun h ↦ ⟨zeroLocus I, ⟨isClosed_zeroLocus I,
>       (isIrreducible_zeroLocus_iff_of_radical _ h.isRadical).mpr h⟩,
>         (vanishingIdeal_zeroLocus_eq_radical I).trans h.radical⟩⟩
> 
> open PrimeSpectrum in
> lemma minimalPrimes.eq_irreducibleComponents :
>     minimalPrimes R =
>     PrimeSpectrum.vanishingIdeal '' (irreducibleComponents <| PrimeSpectrum R) := by
>   rw [irreducibleComponents_eq_maximals_closed, minimalPrimes_eq_minimals, ← minimals_swap,
>     ← PrimeSpectrum.vanishingIdeal_isclosed_isIrreducible, image_minimals_of_rel_iff_rel]
>   intro s t hs _
>   exact vanishingIdeal_anti_mono_iff hs.1
> 
> lemma PrimeSpectrum.zeroLocus_minimalPrimes :
>   zeroLocus ∘ (↑) '' minimalPrimes R =
>     irreducibleComponents (PrimeSpectrum R) := by
>   rw [minimalPrimes.eq_irreducibleComponents, ← Set.image_comp, Set.EqOn.image_eq_self]
>   intros s hs
>   simpa [zeroLocus_vanishingIdeal_eq_closure, closure_eq_iff_isClosed]
>     using isClosed_of_mem_irreducibleComponents s hs
> 
> lemma PrimeSpectrum.mem_irreducibleComponents_iff_vanishingIdeal_mem_minimalPrimes'
>     {s : Set (PrimeSpectrum R)} (hs : IsClosed s) :
>     s ∈ irreducibleComponents (PrimeSpectrum R) ↔ (vanishingIdeal s) ∈ minimalPrimes R := by
>   constructor
>   · rw [minimalPrimes.eq_irreducibleComponents]; exact Set.mem_image_of_mem _
>   · conv_rhs => rw [← zeroLocus_minimalPrimes, ← hs.closure_eq,
>       ← zeroLocus_vanishingIdeal_eq_closure]
>     exact Set.mem_image_of_mem _
> 
> lemma PrimeSpectrum.zeroLocus_ideal_mem_irreducibleComponents_iff_mem_minimalPrime' (I : Ideal R) :
>     zeroLocus I ∈ irreducibleComponents (PrimeSpectrum R) ↔
>     ∃ (J : Ideal R), J ∈ minimalPrimes R ∧ zeroLocus I = zeroLocus (J : Set R) := by
>   rw [← PrimeSpectrum.zeroLocus_minimalPrimes]
>   simp_rw [eq_comm (a := zeroLocus (I : Set R))]
>   rfl
> 
> lemma PrimeSpectrum.zeroLocus_ideal_mem_irreducibleComponents_iff_mem_minimalPrime_of_radical'
>     {I : Ideal R} (hI : I.IsRadical) :
>     zeroLocus I ∈ irreducibleComponents (PrimeSpectrum R) ↔ I ∈ minimalPrimes R := by
>   constructor
>   · conv_rhs => rw [minimalPrimes.eq_irreducibleComponents, ← hI.radical,
>       ← vanishingIdeal_zeroLocus_eq_radical]
>     exact Set.mem_image_of_mem _
>   · rw [← PrimeSpectrum.zeroLocus_minimalPrimes]
>     exact Set.mem_image_of_mem _
> ```

Thanks! I have incoporated your code into this PR
This PR looks good to me now. I rewrote a big chunk of it though so I'll wait for other maintainers (maybe @alreadydone ?) to merge it.
maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by alreadydone.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded!

*And happy new year! 🎉*


  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7375621632/job/20067396226)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7375621632/job/20067395820)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7375621632/job/20067396078)
Thanks @erdOne for switching to use #9190 and suggesting the better forms of the iff lemmas. LGTM now! I'm not a maintainer😅 but let's send this to maintainers after CI.
Thanks @erdOne for switching to use #9190 and suggesting the better forms of the iff lemmas. LGTM now! I'm not a maintainer😅 but let's send this to maintainers after CI.
Maybe belongs to a different file, say `RingTheory` somewhere, but then that file needs to import `AlgebraicGeometry`
Maybe we should put the prime spectrum folder under ring theory instead?

I think something like `orderEquivIrreducibleCloseds` would be a better name (there is [TopologicalSpace.Closeds](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Sets/Closeds.html#TopologicalSpace.Closeds) that you may use).
Is irreducibleSetEquivPoints relevant here?
Nice find. On first glance, it seems the order preserving is in the other direction. I will inspect the function more closely later.
I have changed it to use `irreducibleSetEquivPoints`, thanks!

I think something like `zero_locus ∘ coe '' minimal_primes R = irreducible_components (prime_spectrum R)` or `vanishing_ideal '' irreducible_components (prime_spectrum R) = minimal_primes R` (as an actual equality) could be useful.

Moogle found [irreducibleComponents_eq_maximals_closed](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Irreducible.html#irreducibleComponents_eq_maximals_closed). So this should follow from a general construction that an antitone OrderIso sends `minimals` to `maximals`.
the equality has been added

```suggestion
lemma _root_.minimalPrimes.finite_of_isNoetherianRing : (minimalPrimes R).Finite :=
```
Or maybe `Finite.minimalPrimes_of_isNoetherianRing` to enable dot notation

It's unfortunate that `irreducibleSetEquivPoints` uses specializationOrder which is defined such that a generic point is bigger than a closed point, contrary to the canonical order on PrimeSpectrum given by containment where a minimal prime is smaller than a maximal ideal. Anyway, the two orders are very far from defeq so we still need [PrimeSpectrum.le_iff_specializes](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/AlgebraicGeometry/PrimeSpectrum/Basic.html#PrimeSpectrum.le_iff_specializes) to connect them. ~~I think we should specialize `irreducibleSetEquivPoints` to the case of PrimeSpectrum and make it an antitone OrderIso with the canonical order on PrimeSpectrum.~~ Hmm, this is exactly what we are doing here, but it turns out to be a bit tricky to reuse the existing OrderIso because of the "synthesized type class instance is not definitionally equal" error...
```suggestion
  __ := irreducibleSetEquivPoints.toEquiv.symm.trans OrderDual.toDual
  map_rel_iff' {p q} := show closure {q} ≤ closure {p} ↔ p ≤ q by
    simp [closure_singleton, Set.le_eq_subset, zeroLocus_subset_zeroLocus_iff, q.IsPrime.radical]
```

Okay, using `RelIso.symm` rather than `OrderIso.symm` circumvents the "synthesized type class instance is not definitionally equal" issue:
```suggestion
  __ := irreducibleSetEquivPoints.toEquiv.symm.trans OrderDual.toDual
  map_rel_iff' {p q} :=
    (RelIso.symm irreducibleSetEquivPoints).map_rel_iff.trans (le_iff_specializes p q).symm
```

I'll add some lemma/defs about OrderEmbedding/Iso and minimals/maximals to make this easy to construct using `OrderIso.setCongr`, `OrderIso.dual` together with [irreducibleComponents_eq_maximals_closed](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Irreducible.html#irreducibleComponents_eq_maximals_closed)

With #9190 this becomes
```
  let e : {p : Ideal R | p.IsPrime ∧ ⊥ ≤ p} ≃o PrimeSpectrum R :=
    ⟨⟨fun x ↦ ⟨x.1, x.2.1⟩, fun x ↦ ⟨x.1, x.2, bot_le⟩, fun _ ↦ rfl, fun _ ↦ rfl⟩, Iff.rfl⟩
  (e.trans <| PrimeSpectrum.pointsEquivIrreducibleCloseds R).minimalsIsoMaximals.trans
    (OrderIso.setCongr _ _ <| by simp_rw [irreducibleComponents_eq_maximals_closed, and_comm]).dual
```
If we change the order of IsIrreducible and IsClosed in [irreducibleComponents_eq_maximals_closed](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Irreducible.html#irreducibleComponents_eq_maximals_closed) or [irreducibleSetEquivPoints](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Sober.html#irreducibleSetEquivPoints) so that they match, the simp_rw could just be `(irreducibleComponents_eq_maximals_closed _).symm`.

> With #9190 this becomes
> 
> ```
>   let e : {p : Ideal R | p.IsPrime ∧ ⊥ ≤ p} ≃o PrimeSpectrum R :=
>     ⟨⟨fun x ↦ ⟨x.1, x.2.1⟩, fun x ↦ ⟨x.1, x.2, bot_le⟩, fun _ ↦ rfl, fun _ ↦ rfl⟩, Iff.rfl⟩
>   (e.trans <| PrimeSpectrum.pointsEquivIrreducibleCloseds R).minimalsIsoMaximals.trans
>     (OrderIso.setCongr _ _ <| by simp_rw [irreducibleComponent
> ```

Done, thanks for the suggestion!

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (RelIso.symm irreducibleSetEquivPoints).map_rel_iff.trans (le_iff_specializes p q).symm ```

It might be more useful to show:
+ The vanishing ideal of a closed set is a minimal prime iff the closed set is an irreducible component
+ The zero locus of an ideal is an irreducible component iff the ideal is a minimal prime

You can probably make use of the `map_mem_minimals/maximals` lemmas I introduced in the other PR and then you can derive this easily.

>     * The zero locus of an ideal is an irreducible component iff the ideal is a minimal prime
Without assume ideal being radical, I could only show that the zero locus of an ideal `I` is an irreducible component iff there exists a minimal ideal `J` with the same zero locus as `I`
Oh yes, radicality is necessary. Thanks!
The assumption of radicalness and closedness make the two lemmas hard to apply in this equality lemma.
Following the convention of putting the more complex term on the LHS, maybe we should flip this and call it `PrimeSpectrum.vanishingIdeal_irreducibleComponents`?
done

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion zeroLocus ∘ (↑) '' minimalPrimes R = ```

I think these should be removed in favor of 
```lean
lemma vanishingIdeal_mem_minimalPrimes
    {s : Set (PrimeSpectrum R)} :
    (vanishingIdeal s) ∈ minimalPrimes R ↔ closure s ∈ irreducibleComponents (PrimeSpectrum R) := by
  constructor
  · conv_rhs => rw [← zeroLocus_minimalPrimes,
      ← zeroLocus_vanishingIdeal_eq_closure]
    exact Set.mem_image_of_mem _
  · rw [minimalPrimes.eq_irreducibleComponents, ← vanishingIdeal_closure]
    exact Set.mem_image_of_mem _

lemma zeroLocus_ideal_mem_irreducibleComponents
    {I : Ideal R} :
    zeroLocus I ∈ irreducibleComponents (PrimeSpectrum R) ↔ I.radical ∈ minimalPrimes R := by
  constructor
  · conv_rhs => rw [minimalPrimes.eq_irreducibleComponents,
      ← vanishingIdeal_zeroLocus_eq_radical]
    exact Set.mem_image_of_mem _
  · rw [← PrimeSpectrum.zeroLocus_minimalPrimes, ← zeroLocus_radical]
    exact Set.mem_image_of_mem _
```
maybe even simp lemmas?

I am not sure if they should be simp lemmas, because being minimal and being an irreducible component seems to be both useful, and there might not be a strong preference to always have one being simplified to another.
They get rid of `vanishingIdeal` and `zeroLocus` though. Anyway I don't have a strong preference and I'm fine with either way.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry/PrimeSpectrum/*) : the collection of minimal prime ideals of a Noetherian ring is finite

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Artinian): the collection of maximal ideals in an artinian ring is finite

nodes.body:
I agree with Junyan that we should use #9190 to show these.
Something like 
```lean
lemma minimalPrimes_eq_minimals {R} [CommRing R] :
    minimalPrimes R = minimals (· ≤ ·) (setOf Ideal.IsPrime) :=
  congr_arg (minimals (· ≤ ·)) (by simp)

lemma PrimeSpectrum.vanishingIdeal_isclosed_isIrreducible {R} [CommRing R] :
    vanishingIdeal (R := R) '' {s | IsClosed s ∧ IsIrreducible s} = setOf Ideal.IsPrime :=
  Set.ext fun I ↦ ⟨fun ⟨s, ⟨hs, hs'⟩, e⟩ ↦
    e ▸ (isIrreducible_zeroLocus_iff_of_radical _ (isRadical_vanishingIdeal s)).mp
      (by rwa [zeroLocus_vanishingIdeal_eq_closure, hs.closure_eq]),
    fun h ↦ ⟨zeroLocus I, ⟨isClosed_zeroLocus I,
      (isIrreducible_zeroLocus_iff_of_radical _ h.isRadical).mpr h⟩,
        (vanishingIdeal_zeroLocus_eq_radical I).trans h.radical⟩⟩

open PrimeSpectrum in
lemma minimalPrimes.eq_irreducibleComponents :
    minimalPrimes R =
    PrimeSpectrum.vanishingIdeal '' (irreducibleComponents <| PrimeSpectrum R) := by
  rw [irreducibleComponents_eq_maximals_closed, minimalPrimes_eq_minimals, ← minimals_swap,
    ← PrimeSpectrum.vanishingIdeal_isclosed_isIrreducible, image_minimals_of_rel_iff_rel]
  intro s t hs _
  exact vanishingIdeal_anti_mono_iff hs.1

lemma PrimeSpectrum.zeroLocus_minimalPrimes :
  zeroLocus ∘ (↑) '' minimalPrimes R =
    irreducibleComponents (PrimeSpectrum R) := by
  rw [minimalPrimes.eq_irreducibleComponents, ← Set.image_comp, Set.EqOn.image_eq_self]
  intros s hs
  simpa [zeroLocus_vanishingIdeal_eq_closure, closure_eq_iff_isClosed]
    using isClosed_of_mem_irreducibleComponents s hs

lemma PrimeSpectrum.mem_irreducibleComponents_iff_vanishingIdeal_mem_minimalPrimes'
    {s : Set (PrimeSpectrum R)} (hs : IsClosed s) :
    s ∈ irreducibleComponents (PrimeSpectrum R) ↔ (vanishingIdeal s) ∈ minimalPrimes R := by
  constructor
  · rw [minimalPrimes.eq_irreducibleComponents]; exact Set.mem_image_of_mem _
  · conv_rhs => rw [← zeroLocus_minimalPrimes, ← hs.closure_eq,
      ← zeroLocus_vanishingIdeal_eq_closure]
    exact Set.mem_image_of_mem _

lemma PrimeSpectrum.zeroLocus_ideal_mem_irreducibleComponents_iff_mem_minimalPrime' (I : Ideal R) :
    zeroLocus I ∈ irreducibleComponents (PrimeSpectrum R) ↔
    ∃ (J : Ideal R), J ∈ minimalPrimes R ∧ zeroLocus I = zeroLocus (J : Set R) := by
  rw [← PrimeSpectrum.zeroLocus_minimalPrimes]
  simp_rw [eq_comm (a := zeroLocus (I : Set R))]
  rfl

lemma PrimeSpectrum.zeroLocus_ideal_mem_irreducibleComponents_iff_mem_minimalPrime_of_radical'
    {I : Ideal R} (hI : I.IsRadical) :
    zeroLocus I ∈ irreducibleComponents (PrimeSpectrum R) ↔ I ∈ minimalPrimes R := by
  constructor
  · conv_rhs => rw [minimalPrimes.eq_irreducibleComponents, ← hI.radical,
      ← vanishingIdeal_zeroLocus_eq_radical]
    exact Set.mem_image_of_mem _
  · rw [← PrimeSpectrum.zeroLocus_minimalPrimes]
    exact Set.mem_image_of_mem _
```

> I agree with Junyan that we should use #9190 to show these. Something like
> 
> ```lean
> lemma minimalPrimes_eq_minimals {R} [CommRing R] :
>     minimalPrimes R = minimals (· ≤ ·) (setOf Ideal.IsPrime) :=
>   congr_arg (minimals (· ≤ ·)) (by simp)
> 
> lemma PrimeSpectrum.vanishingIdeal_isclosed_isIrreducible {R} [CommRing R] :

>   simpa [zeroLocus_vanishingIdeal_eq_closure, closure_eq_iff_isClosed]
>     using isClosed_of_mem_irreducibleComponents s hs

>   constructor
>   · rw [minimalPrimes.eq_irreducibleComponents]; exact Set.mem_image_of_mem _

>       ← zeroLocus_vanishingIdeal_eq_closure]

>     ∃ (J : Ideal R), J ∈ minimalPrimes R ∧ zeroLocus I = zeroLocus (J : Set R) := by
>   rw [← PrimeSpectrum.zeroLocus_minimalPrimes]
>   simp_rw [eq_comm (a := zeroLocus (I : Set R))]
>   rfl
> 
> lemma PrimeSpectrum.zeroLocus_ideal_mem_irreducibleComponents_iff_mem_minimalPrime_of_radical'
>     {I : Ideal R} (hI : I.IsRadical) :
>     zeroLocus I ∈ irreducibleComponents (PrimeSpectrum R) ↔ I ∈ minimalPrimes R := by

>       ← vanishingIdeal_zeroLocus_eq_radical]
